member.name: P:Amazon.Finspace.Model.CreateEnvironmentRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description of the FinSpace environment to be created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Finspace.Model.CreateEnvironmentRequest.FederationMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FederationMode.
Authentication mode for the environment.
FEDERATED - Users access FinSpace through Single Sign On (SSO) via your Identity provider.
LOCAL - Users access FinSpace via email and password managed within the FinSpace environment.

member.summary:

Configuration information when authentication mode is FEDERATED.

member.summary:

The KMS key id to encrypt your data in the FinSpace environment.

member.summary:

The name of the FinSpace environment to be created.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ApplicationCallBackURL.
The redirect or sign-in URL that should be entered into the SAML 2.0 compliant identity provider configuration (IdP).

member.name: P:Amazon.Finspace.Model.FederationParameters.AttributeMap
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeMap.
SAML attribute name and value. The name must always be Email and the value should be set to the attribute definition in which user email is set. For example, name would be Email and value http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress. Please check your SAML 2.0 compliant identity provider (IdP) documentation for details.

member.name: P:Amazon.Finspace.Model.FederationParameters.SamlMetadataURL
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.Finspace.AmazonFinspaceClient

Implementation for accessing Finspace
The FinSpace management service provides the APIs for managing the FinSpace environments.

member.name: M:Amazon.Finspace.AmazonFinspaceClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonFinspaceClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
